reviews.review_msg: the average on the first midterm was around 30%. the lectures were very dry and he did not do office hours. the written assignment was a grade booster though. no final exam which is nice, just 3 midterms.

Dr. Beischlag is very clear in getting his point across in lectures. He explains things in a way that makes any complex content seem straight forward. He also is very good in prepping students for tests, and clearly tells you what you need to memorize beforehand. If you attend most/all of his lectures, it is impossible to flunk the class.

Penny is nice person and makes her own effort. However, as an undergrad and an arts student; this pre-req for HSCI is taught and meant for graduates. Very difficult to grasp content, suffered greatly with all the effort put into her class. Content is interesting, but everything is self taught and memorization.. Good luck.

Penny Deck (HSCI 100) is the most AWFUL professor I've had in my undergraduate degree (3rd year student, 3.0 GPA average going in). She sits in front of her laptop, reads off slides for 3 hrs. No motivation. No experience teaching. Posts slides & hands out survey responses LAST MINUTE. Terrible and the most unfair exams I've ever written.

Lecture notes are nothing but pictures. spends 1 slide and barely any class time on something, yet makes a question about it worth 12 pt on the midterm. class average of 55% on the MT and she wont scale I get that this is her first year teaching this course, and apparently her bpk classes are better (according to her) but just dont. not with her.

If you do not biology don't take this course as an elective just because you did well in bio12. LOTS of material covered and ALL memorization and conceptualization. Slides are useless as she doesn't include all from the lecture and most are pictures from the text (aligns with text well). Self taught myself everything by going through the textbook.

I didn't go to a single class so idk what you are supposed to do in tutorials but I did the bare minimum and got a C which is all you need to pass. if you actually give a shiz, you'll do good. this class is not difficult unless you make it out to be.
Professor Frank Lee was an absolute gem, highly reccomend you take his courses. You can see the passion for this class in his eyes and he cares and loves his students. Love this guy!

It is not based on power points or textbook use. The long answer questions on the midterms are simple (for simple minded people). This class is easy you can have a job and a full course load. Your study will take little time with little effort, yet yield a high grade. :)

It is purely based on his lengthy power point slides and textbook material. Even though quizzes are mainly multiple choice, the exam long answer question are tough. This class is doable if you do not have any other important classes or jobs outside of school. Your study time will revolve around this class. And you won't even get a good grade.
Thank you frank.
frank is a gem

Lectures are boring, reads straight off the powerpoint slides and doesnt give any other info. He includes random info into his quizzes that weren't taught by him. He said that the textbook for this course isn't required, but make sure to buy it; you will need to teach yourself this course, and you will only pass quizzes if you read the textbook.

Ian is such a good prof! His lectures are informative and he goes the extra mile during class to make sure students understand the material. Super responsive to questions and clearly cares about what he does. He was very clear about what we would be tested on for the midterm exams, and I don't remember any surprises. Huge recommend.

Hands down my favourtie prof at SFU . He's extremely passionate about the stuff he teaches and makes a few jokes here and there. A great start to Biology in University. Class was curved so even if I failed the midterm I still passed with a B-. One group presentation and one assignment. Totally recommend buying the textbook if you're new to bio!

Loved him. Extremely passionate about what he teaches which makes you want to come to class. No textbook only slides. One of those profs who loves what they teach instead of making you miserable and fail. Class average was low but curved so I still did fine. Recommend for intro health science classes similar content to bio 12 in high school.

Ian is awesome! His lectures are thorough and easy to follow. He adds in lots of helpful diagrams, charts and info in his lecture slides which make them great to study off of. He also types up a summary of all the chapters and a list of concepts to know for each exam (midterms and final). I would definitely take another class with him!
easy peasy :)
Great prof! If you know the learning objectives you are guaranteed to get a good grade.

if you know the learning outcomes at the beginning of each chapter on her powerpoint notes then you're good to go for the midterms and the final. Textbook is not needed for this class you only need her notes! Fairly easy class

The first lecture I had with Dr. Hilton, I thought she was arrogant for making us call her "Dr. Hilton" without yet having her Ph.D. However, since then I had nothing but positive things to say about Dr. Hilton! She has a good sense of humor, cares about student needs and was very organized. Class is scaled so beware as many people score high.
Easy class!

She is a great prof! Her test are based on learning objectives she provides. She does go through content fairly quickly but if you are update with readings/lecture notes it will be ok. This course was relatively easy, definitely a GPA booster.

She is a pretty good teacher. She is extremely organized. All of the assignments and tests are marked fairly and handed back quickly. She is keen to help students and keeps her office hours.Overall, good teacher and would recommend the class.

i dunno why some people are giving her a bad review. She's crystal clear for what you need to know for the midterms and gives away easy marks! I found this class a breeze cause i took bio in high school. Def a GPA booster

I was extremely disappointed that the class switched from Mark Lechner to Laura. I'm not sure what the people who say this class is a GPA booster are talking about. Perhaps if you put a lot of time into studying, but the tests are ridiculously hard. Laura is very disorganized and goes through the material much too fast.
She is so confused with the new school system and always mess up people's marks. Always skips slices and basically read through the materials

This course is super easy with Dr. Hilton.  Textbook is not 100% required, but it is helpful on the molecular biology parts.  Attending lecture is not necessary, but you still need to attend them for the iclicker quizzes.  Tutorials are almost useless, but again, you still need to attend those for marks.  Definitely a GPA booster.
Relatively easy class, and she is unbelievably hot.  Exams are pretty easy, and even if you dont do well, only worth 50% of final grade.

Dr Hilton was a bit lost at first, but I think it was because it was her first time teaching the course. As she responded to student feedback she taught at a much better pace. She is a nice person to talk to as well. I overall really enjoy her.

I know her making us call her Dr. Hilton rubbed a lot of people the wrong way. She got a whole lot nicer as semester went on though! There is a lot of course material and I feel like it would be better to have lots of quizzes so as to break up the material :)

At first I thought she was a nut job, but as the semester went on, she loosened up a lot. She is really nice and very clear on what she wants you to know/what will be on the midterms (which are really fair) The course is split up really weird (20% for a tutorial presentation with a 2 page write up..) It's easy if you have some bio experience.
Dr. Hilton is super nice & she's SUPER clear on exactly what you need to know for the midterms! I highly recommend taking this course with her! Great prof!
this course is easy and exams are easy. You have to contact her by using canvas not email. she reply pretty quick if you use canvas. A lot of free grades just for trying. and she is hot

If you have taken bio throughout high school and were good at it this class will be a breeze! the lectures are boring but have to go to them for iclicker questions. Both the midterms were super fair and fairly easy if you know your stuff. Focus on lecture notes textbook not really useful, I barely ever touch it.

Makes us call her Dr.Hilton when she hasn't even obtained her PhD. Does not even reply to online discussions. Won't even give an email to contact her. She really needs to change her arrogant attitude. If she doesn't then I hope this will be her first and last class she teaches.

Dr. N is very kind and always helpful. Lectures are fun, but be very careful with what she skips. 
Exams are understandable and are based on what she talks about in class. 

TA are respectful and fun to be around; they help you understand the content and assist you with your written paper if you're stuck.

She is a really nice person; she is caring and accommodating. however, she lacks humour, and classes are a little boring. but it's an easy class. it's a little reading heavy. lectures were recorded. and class notes are easy to navigate. overall was a good class.
Her lectures are very boring as she just reads off the lecture notes so a-lot of people tend to skip and learn on their own. Do not recommend this professor.

Best prof so far. She is very clear about what will be on the midterm/final. Lectures are recorded. Review of Bio 12. Textbook was optional I never used it because everything needed was on lecture slides. Her lecture slides had plenty of info to learn from. Shes nice and caring, she can be monotone but her lectures are still interesting. Recommend.

I took this course as it was required. I didn't attend any classes because I didn't get what she taught in class. If you don't have a biology background, I would strongly recommend not to take this course with her. The course is super easy, but the way she teaches makes it super difficult and you won't understand anything if you don't have biology.
Easy class overall, but really boring

Okay, so I've been in this class for a solid 2 weeks. I'm a fourth year student, and out of all the courses I've ever taken, this is by far the most disorganized. Literally absolutely nothing is organized in this class. So far, the class is really easy, but the disorganization makes it suck.
A bit monotone, but she knows her stuff. Honestly, just studying the lecture notes a week before an exam and you'll do fine. It's easy to get an A, as long as you're good at memorizing.

One group project (an easy one). Really liked her humor - she sounds a bit monotone, but she's really cool when you look past that and chat with her. Overall, she's easy to understand and very fair with exams and grading. No complaints with her. Actually knows how to use TopHat too. Just keep up with your notes!
Interactive lectures and tutorials. Best prof. Is funny at times. Keeps the class interactive
very easy, review of bio 12 in high school
Not a good prof, grade given is ambiguous

Definitely recommend this class, was an easy A. All midterm/final questions are directly out of the lecture notes! A lot of multiple choice can be found in the recommended reading so probably have that handy.

Fun class and very interesting! Lectures are very fast, so make sure notes are written  before hand to better understand during class.  She is very nice and very open to questions and comments! Overall, fair class.

Attended 2013 fall. Great instructor, willing to help, clarifies when needed, but agree that lectures are "lightening" fast. Tutorials, meh!  Just read the text and her slides, plus complete Mastering Biology materials and you'll do fine.
Definitely a very humorous prof, she was clear on the material she was presenting.

Know your textbook and Mastering BIology material. Her tests are based alot on Q's from Mastering biology. She knows teaches well, and her exams were fair. I ended up with a C, but somehow she curves it to a B+...

Rambled on during lectures. Detailed quizzes where you need to memorize the textbook to pass. Averages were low. Nice personality but very disorganized and doesn't seem to know the material very well. Goes over material lightning-fast. I learned more from the textbook than from her. Only take if you like memorizing millions of facts on your own.

She is clear and consise during lectures, comes to class organized and prepared, and she tries to make the class laugh. Some said she covers material too fast, but thats necessary in order to complete the course on time. The textbook and online quizzes & videos were very helpful. For the most part, exams are fair. I highly recommend this prof!

Seriously a great proff. Funny in cass to keep the students engages, favourite proff of the semester. Knows her subject material really well, only took the class because an older friend told me she was his favourite, and they were right. Hard to get good marks, but then again its university, so you have to expect you need to study. Take her class.
Easiest teacher i've had so far! She's tries hard to help her students succeed in the class. She's pretty funny too! :)
Hard exams and many activities.Tiring course.
very nice, but there is a lot of reading. reasonalbe exams, with a class ave of 70-73. just like bio 11 and 12. uses web ct but not recorded.
Great prof and engaging classes! Made it very clear what we need to know for the exams. He is approachable outside class, and truly cares about the class and their success.
Eddie was one of my favorite first year profs! Interesting topics, engaging lectures and fair exams. Very approachable

You can tell he cares. However, the lectures are boring. Exams and midterms were fair - sometimes you don't know what topics are more important to study than others. This term, our average ended up being low. Sometimes it is hard to understand him because of his accent.

Exams were fair and straightforward. You could just study off of the slides. However, he wasn't a good lecturer at all and wasn't receptive to students' feedback about his lectures. Also, his lecture slides had too much content and way more info than you needed to know. The only reason to go to lecture is for the iClickers/participation marks

A great prof. Very knowledgeable, wants the students to understand the material, and encourages group discussions during class. The slides were clear and posted after each class. Exams were challenging but fair and have bonus questions  all the material was covered in class. Recommended!

Kind professor, very knowledgeable about topics and has an interest in diseases which he adds to lectures to help you better understand the material. Kind of soft-spoken, even with a mic so don't be afraid to ask him to raise the volume. Exams were fair. Be sure to attend lectures, as he uses iclickers for participation.

Teaches like a bad high school teacher, does nothing useful in class other than give childish "pop quizzes" or crossword puzzles (which count for marks), gives a ton of online work, but is completely unorganized about it, tutorials are useless and based on irrelevant material. overall not a good prof

Her lecture is not really helpful for the midterms. Because all she does in the class is just going over the powerpoints, giving exercises and popquiz.And the questions in the exams are more like applied question. knowing the mechanisms of somthing is not enough for the midterms. we are not the grad students.not helpful lecture,and ask too much.

The class was a great introductory to topics in human and environmental health. Lecture notes were very helpful in giving a guideline for things to study. She allows cheat sheets for the first 10 minutes of class and you can pretty much do quite well if you read the material in the textbook once.

Tim is a good person but does expect students to have prior knowledge despite no prerq for this course. Dont recommend unless mandatory. All info dumped on slides + no clear learning outcomes provided which makes studying for tests hell. He curved first midterm but class average was not great. Final was tough with majority written questions.

Lectures not very engaging, and slides are often filled to the brim. Over 50% of the course failed the first midterm, so he raised the grades up by 30%, and took student feedback for how the next midterm should be formatted. I had a great TA as well. Lots of reading and details, so get ready for that!

This course covers a lot of content in a lot of detail and exams, as expected, are super specific. Knowledge of specific biological terms is a must. First exam was curved heavily because of low average. Dr. Beischlag is responsive to student needs and changed the format of the next exam which was really appreciated !
lectures so boring and heavy, he doesnt really care about students and gives no exam prep or guidance. 3 midterms each 28% with questions about random details. do not recommend him

Slides were just filled to the max. Two or three chapters assigned most weeks. Multiple choice exams based on very specific details rather than concepts. no guidance for studying, prof read lectures off from the ppt. Memorizing slides barely helps. Flashcards also wont help, just so much disorganized info. Memorize textbook + lecture

Dr. Beischlag makes lectures engaging. He uses analogies that are easy to understand. Exams are very straightforward and mainly based on lecture recordings. However, the textbook provides good info for reference or simply a better understanding of the concepts. There is minimal communication with him directly, but the TA's are very responsive.

Pablo is THE MAN! Just go to class & listen, its not hard.. srsly. I took 216 in summer condensed, so we had no readings, but listening to his lectures was more than enough, and he's the best for help during office hours.. or outside office hours, he's always available ;) lol

Darwin Worshipper- definitely pushed that on the class. He's a really nice guy, cares about his students and willing to interact. A lot of the course was disorganized and there was an overwhelming amount of content. Lectures were pretty boring on the whole. If you're passionate about HSCI you shouldn't have a problem though. Just study. A lot.

Grade mostly based on 3 tests, each worth 25%, each has ~25 multiple choice questions. Tests aren't overly difficult but can be hard to get perfect score on. Lectures aren't particularly helpful, he hints 1 or 2 times test material, but otherwise, he reads off lecture slides that are provided on webct after class. He is extremely nice though =]

Pablo is a great prof and is very passionate about the material. Questions and class discussion are highly encouraged. Keeps class interesting and is very funny. He completely changed my way of thinking (for the better!). Oh, and his exams are very easy.
Awesome teacher, very passionate about biology. Courses are straightforward and well organized
he is a super awesome prof. easy exams!
One of my favorite profs at SFU so far!

Pablo is very lively and passionate about his field. I was in his first class as a teacher, and he was eager to adjust to our learning requirements, and even let us help write exam questions. He will reward you for your effort and participation (if he knows who you are) so don't be afraid to speak up in class, as he encourages it.

Really hard to follow most of the time. He was very encouraging and as a person he is a very nice and very interested in his field. My only problem was although I got a HIGH A on every single assignment and every exam I somehow ended up with a B... If you are looking for an A don't take this class unless you plan on getting perfect on everything.

Uses the American grading system so 93% is considered an A-.  But a lot of the marks in this course come from tutorials and his exams are fair so it's not that hard to get a good mark.  He sometimes goes too fast so it's impossible to take notes.  Has some funny jokes and is a good prof overall.
ok i guess.
The only prof in the world who uses an American system to grade... but tells you after - if you get an 85% final grade, be prepared for a 'B'.

Dr. Hogg is a monotone teacher that the lectures tend to be boring. It is mandatory to go to class because of group work. But, I feel like he will mark you present even though you are absent. I didn't really learn a lot because he reads through the lecture slides and skips over some lectures so we can read them in our own time
Could not keep the class controlled, was way too loud and the material on the exam did not reflect what was taught in class whatsoever. Complete waste of my time.
BEST PROF EVER he is so nice and caring and his lectures are very enjoyable
Very caring prof, lectures were easy to follow
amazing

Mark clearly cares lots about his students and this class did not have much homework (a paper, journal, 3 exams). When he teaches, he teaches well. My only qualm is that he does not teach all the time, he skips through important slides and forces students to learn on their own time. He rambles or answers questions for most of lecture time.

Lechner has such a pure and caring energy. He is extremely thoughtful of the Indigenous' contributions to science/biology and offers that perspective on top of the western perspective. i do find lectures to be surface level and in a way where if you didn't take biology in highschool,you might find it hard to learn? Still would take his class again!

Dr. Lechner's lectures are easy to follow and he gives many chances for students to ask questions, and spends extra time clarifying if needed. He provides study guides for all three exams which are super helpful! Also, every lecture he pops in a 'joke' or two, which keep you engaged in the content. Overall, I would recommend taking his class!

He's such a funny, sweet, and knowledgable prof. He breaks everything down and his material is pretty clear and easy to understand. I wasn't able to keep up with the readings and I didn't focus on this class as much as I should've, but it was still very helpful just going to lectures.

so so dry and not using Iclicker for his class, we are using Tophat for his class, it sucks b/c ur paying much extra money for registering, And Tophat needs wifi to connect but sometimes at his lecture hall there is no service, so U don't get ur mark?? He canceled 1 lecture but didn't makeup for it, so we have Mt#1 covering unfamiliar materials

Mark is such a sweetheart. His lectures can be boring and difficult but he makes a clear effort to keep students engaged with videos, games, and terribly-wonderful jokes. I have no background in human biology and found this course to be difficult. I ended up getting a tutor which really helped. If I was better at bio I'd take another class with him

Honestly found the class pretty hard. Slides are filled in size 9 font with so much information, and for one of the chapters he just told us to read the slides outside of class. For someone who just took this as an elective, I didn't enjoy it at all. Also, tutorials were such a waste of time!

Mark is a great prof! Provides lecture slides and audio recordings online, so lecture attendance isn't mandatory, but i'd still go. He makes an effort to make lectures fun, provides many videos/games to help clarify concepts. He gives you many opportunities to receive extra credit. Exams were fair but cover a lot of info so study & go to tutorial!

Dr. Lechner is so passionate about what he teaches and clearly cares about his students. His exams are fair & straightforward and he gives many opportunities for extra credit. I definitely recommend taking his classes, you won't regret it!

Mark is awesome, EVERYONE can understand the concepts he explains. Encourage discussions in class, available for extra help, can meet outside of regular office hours, always ready to answer questions on the way. Mark points out clearly what will be tested and not you just need to listen carefully. Be active and you can get extra points! The best!

I m an international student with poor bio background. I felt it difficult for me, and my exams scores are very low, but presentation+report, tophat, participation, individual report are easy to get high marks(over 95%).  good prof and highly recommended

With a biology 12 background, it was not hard to excel this class. Even without any biology knowledge, Lechner provides lengthy office hours for additional help, whether on concepts or more in depth understanding in one chapter. Though his lectures are usually in the mornings, his jokes help brighten up the mood!

Mark is a really nice guy, he gives students a chance to get bonus marks, by participation. His final exam was fair but the midterms were more on the difficult side. You do NOT need the textbook, exam material is all on lecture slides. Mark is open to helping students, he is approachable and always helps. One of the best profs.

Very nice and helpful when approached, but lectures can be confusing. Big question on the final was based on what he said in lecture. Don't buy Bad Science: you only need 1 chapter for presentation. Textbook (4e) helps but tests are based on lectures. Tutorials are great for review. Get the presentation done early and make sure you follow criteria
He is a good prof, understanding and funny! I wish his lectures were a little less dry but hey, you can't have it all.

An averagely good professor! No need to go to class, he posts everything online (but there is 5% for going to lecture). Average/hard tests, I reccommend buying the text book even though he says it isn't nessicary. Go to tutorial as they review everything learned in class and it will really help!
Definitely amazing prof one of the best I had at sfu.  vary clear always there to help would like to take more courses with him good experience by taking course with him
Lots of memorization and readings. Quite difficult for a 100 level course.
Prof. Lechner is an amazing Prof! He likes to give out free bonus marks for just asking questions in lectures. There was no final but three midterms based off lecture slides. Would recommend 10.
He's Just amazing. Always there to help! If anything is confusing just go to his office hours or go to your TA. If you understand the concepts then you are good to go.
Great prof. Did not enjoy the course content, however he did his best to make it interesting. Very approachable if you need help :)

Mark's actually the best! His lectures can be a little boring (but aren't all lectures?) but he's super helpful, answer's questions during lectures and stays after too! He makes sure that everyone understands the material. He tells pretty corny jokes too. Don't need textbook (although useful at times), just listen to his lectures and slides! :)

To clear up some things, a 90% is NOT a B+, it's the minimum for an A-. This class has a lot of material, but Lechner's slides are the best, he's always available to help,and gives out study guides. I worked hard for an A, it's doable. He gave me a lot of pointers, and  so far he's my favourite prof at SFU. Plus he tells the best, corny dad-jokes
One of the best profs I've had at SFU. However, his grading scheme is absolutely ridiculous. How is 90% a B+? Going to his lecture is helpful, but it is not mandatory in order to do well.

Mark is an awesome prof. In the beginning, I thought that his grading scale was ridiculous too, but with such a high grading scale, it only means that this course is really easy. This course isn't hard, as long as you study and work hard, you will ace this course. The scientific method assignment is also worth a lot, so make sure you ace that.
It was a pretty ok course but his grading scale is bs. If you get under 70% it's a D. In a regular course, I should've gotten a B but instead I was left with a C. Not cool.
Mark is a great prof but his grading rubric is absolutely horrible
Mark is a great prof. However his grading rubric leaves a lot to desire. An 79% = a C+, 80% = B. WHATTTT!!!! Not ok. 36

he doesn't teach everything in the textbook.  all his exams are based on his lecture slides only so if you study that then you're good.  you actually don't need to buy the textbook. just buy the Bad Science novel for the group project.

One of the best profs i've had in my 4 years. Very passionate about material and makes science fun by showing interesting videos and telling jokes. Assignments are easy and exams are fair, though there is a lot to memorize. Highly recommend if you need a B-sci credit or gpa booster especially if you have taken bio 12.

Great professor! Mark is well organized, knowledgable and humble. He encourages questions in class and even remembers people's names, which I have never seen before in such a big lecture! Exams are fair and the course material is very interesting. Mark is not bad looking either ;) I highly recommend taking this course if you get the chance!!
My favorite prof in SFU. Just study his notes, and you will do great! Take his class!!

Exams are all based on his lecture notes !! He is well organized, he also provides lecture recordings and study guide for the exams!! OVERALL HES AN EXCELLENT PROF !!! Would surely love to take another course with this prof!
great prof! gives out bonus marks if you ask questions, and he really cares about his students and hes passionate about what he teaches, he knows everything!
One of the best profs at SFU. Really knows his stuff, Good presenter, really loves the material. Overall great prof, easy class. A+
Excellent professor!! lecture notes are helpful for midterm and final.

I like the way of how he teaches! He teaches students in a fun way.. played jeopardy in class and gave out bonus points which I believe it's a good way to motivate students to participate in class. His exams are fair and easy! Study his powerpoint and you will get good grade!

One of the best classes taken at simon fraser just because of the prof!! His lectures, even though early in the morning, were extremely useful. His powerpoint notes are really good to study off of because they are summarized nicely! Overall Prof is quite kind, has good teaching skills and easy to approach!

Dr Lechner is super nice and very knowledgeable and enjoys the subject he is teaching. Is is always in the lab in his free time so you can tell he is passionate about what he is doing. I'm glad I took his class and hope i can take more of his classes.
Great prof! he knows his stuff, has a great sense of humour(usually adds simpsons bits to his powerpoint slides) and his tests were all multiple choice...great prof to have!
Good prof very friendly, he makes the course very straight forward and if you stick to his lecture notes you should be fine. However the course material is quite overwhelming.
Personally, I think he's a pretty good teacher. I am currently in his HSCI 100. The textbook is good to have, but reading the lecture notes is even better! I like this course!
